instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 No Camera
threads.message: Working on an 820-3662 with no camera. Tried known good camera/LCD and still a no go. Did some diode measuring and I I get .400 on pins 2&3 but reading short on pin 4.

threads.title: 820-3662 No Camera
threads.message: Oh dear god I think I found the Issue. L4010 went NUCLEAR. Why would that happen?

threads.title: 820-3662 No Camera
threads.message: Check for short at pin 12/J4002 w/ and w/o camera connected.

threads.title: 820-3662 No Camera
threads.message: I assume you were wanting to see if the camera itself cause L4010 to melt.

threads.title: 820-3662 No Camera
threads.message:
Yes, but no short.
Replace it and try; you can use a tiny wire instead...

threads.title: 820-3662 No Camera
threads.message: So I dug out the melted inductor, soldered wires to a new one next to the missing pads and solder masked it to the board we now have a working camera. This one is solved. Thanks!
